name: Teff (Whole Grain)
properties: Tiny ancient grain native to Ethiopia
Smallest grain in the world (size of a poppy seed)
Cannot be processed/refined due to tiny size - always whole grain
Excellent source of iron and calcium
High in resistant starch (feeds gut bacteria)
Good source of protein with complete amino acid profile
Rich in fiber, especially compared to other grains
Contains manganese, phosphorus, copper, and zinc
benefits: Supports gut health with high resistant starch content
Excellent plant-based iron source for preventing anemia
Provides sustained energy from complex carbohydrates
Helps regulate blood sugar with low glycemic impact
Supports bone health with calcium and minerals
Promotes satiety and weight management with high fiber
May slow stomach-emptying for extended fullness
Safe for those with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity
synergies: Pairs with black lentils for complete protein profile
Combines with berbere spice blend in Ethiopian cuisine
Works well with kale and other greens
Complements other whole grains in grain bowls
amount: 1/2 to 1 cup cooked teff per serving

quotes: The recipes in this section may introduce you to grains you haven't had before, such as sorghum and teff.
